dt: {bc}to cause to make a loud noise
{bc}to force (one's way) through with loud {a_link|crashing} noises
{bc}to enter or attend without invitation or without paying
{bc}to move toward aggressively (as in fighting for a rebound)
{bc}to cause (a computer system, component, or program) to crash
{bc}to break or go to pieces with or as if with violence and noise
{bc}to fall, land, or hit with destructive force

sls: of a computer system, component, or program
dt: {bc}to suffer a sudden major failure usually with attendant loss of data
{bc}to move or force one's way with or as if with a crash
{bc}to experience the aftereffects (such as fatigue, irritability, headache, or depression) of a physiologically or psychologically active substance

dt.t: Prolonged use of cocaine—repeatedly cycles of euphoria, {wi}crashing{/wi}, and craving—probably brings about changes in the postsynaptic neurons …
{wi}Crashing{/wi} from a sugar high never helped anyone remain awake all night.

dt: {bc}to go to bed or fall asleep

dt.t: {wi}crashing{/wi} with friends for a few days
It happens every afternoon like clockwork … I'm {wi}crashing{/wi}, my body says. I need salt. Sugar. Fat. Now.

shortdef: to break violently and noisily : smash
to cause to make a loud noise

dt: {bc}a breaking to pieces by or as if by collision
{bc}a sudden decline (as of a population) or failure (as of a business)
{bc}the sudden, powerful occurrence of adverse aftereffects (such as fatigue, irritability, headache, or depression) following the use of a physiologically or psychologically active substance

dt.t: … the jitters, euphoria and eventual {wi}crash{/wi} that come after caffeine or amphetamines.
When it comes to snacks, bars can have a nutritional edge over candy. Many are lower in fat and sugars. And some bars might be less likely to cause sugar rushes followed by {wi}crashes{/wi}.

shortdef: a loud sound (as of things smashing)
a breaking to pieces by or as if by collision

dt: {bc}marked by a concerted effort and effected in the shortest possible time especially to meet emergency conditions

shortdef: marked by a concerted effort and effected in the shortest possible time especially to meet emergency conditions

dt: {bc}a coarse fabric used for draperies, toweling, and clothing and for strengthening joints of cased-in books

shortdef: a coarse fabric used for draperies, toweling, and clothing and for strengthening joints of cased-in books

dt: {bc}a cart stocked with emergency medical equipment, supplies, and drugs for use by medical personnel especially during efforts to resuscitate a patient experiencing cardiac arrest

shortdef: a cart stocked with emergency medical equipment, supplies, and drugs for use by medical personnel especially during efforts to resuscitate a patient experiencing cardiac arrest

dt: {bc}a rapid and intense course of study
{bc}an experience that resembles such a course

dt.t: has been given a {it}crash course{/it} in diplomacy in his first weeks in office

shortdef: a rapid and intense course of study; also : an experience that resembles such a course

dt: {bc}a dive made by a submarine in the least possible time

shortdef: a dive made by a submarine in the least possible time

dt: {bc}a helmet that is worn (as by motorcyclists) as protection for the head in the event of an accident

shortdef: a helmet that is worn (as by motorcyclists) as protection for the head in the event of an accident

dt: {bc}to land (an airplane or spacecraft) under emergency conditions usually with damage to the craft

shortdef: to land (an airplane or spacecraft) under emergency conditions usually with damage to the craft
to crash-land an airplane or spacecraft

dt: {bc}protective padding (as on the inside of an automobile or a tank)
